results.question: What is the definition of deferred revenues?
gold_answer: Performance obligations for which payments have been received by the customer prior to revenue recognition.
results.markdown_table_response: Deferred revenue is revenue that is not recorded on the balance sheet but is accounted for in the current period's earnings, usually in the period in which it is received. Deferred revenue is generally recognized in the period in which it is received, but may be deferred to a later period or may be paid to a customer or other party. The customer, or other party, may use the deferred revenue to meet the performance obligations of a service provider.

The deferred software and deferred subscription-based service performance obligations are anticipated to be recognized over the useful life or service periods of one to eighteen months.

results.markdown_table_response: The following is a list of the key terms and conditions of the stock option grant or restricted stock unit award.
results.csv_string_response:
1. Non-employee directors are appointed on the same day as the annual meeting of stockholders. The non-employee director's appointment to the Board of Directors is determined by the annual meeting of stockholders.
2. Non-employee directors who are appointed after the annual meeting of stockholders will receive a restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of their appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant.
3. If the non-employee director’s appointment to the Board of Directors is not a restricted stock unit award, the pro-rated amount of the annual grant is forfeited and the grant date fair value of the award is used to determine the grant date fair value of the award.
4. If the non-employee director's appointment to the Board of Directors is a restricted stock unit award, the non-employee director is required to wait one year after the annual meeting of stockholders to receive the award. The award date fair value is used to determine the grant date fair value of the award.

results.question: How is Basic earnings per share, or EPS calculated?
gold_answer: by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents.
results.markdown_table_response:
Net income (loss) per share is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted earnings per share is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive. In periods in which the Company has a net loss, dilutive common stock equivalents are excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS.

• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital expenditures in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to 2018, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

results.question: What was the change in the percentage to net sales for segment operating income (loss) between 2017 and 2018?
results.markdown_table_response:
The percentage to net sales for segment operating income (loss) for the fiscal years ending March 31, 2018 and 2017 is:
Net sales (1)
Film and Electrolytic net sales of $202.0 million in fiscal year 2018 increased $19.7 million or 10.8% from $182.2 million in fiscal year 2017. The increase in net sales was primarily driven by an increase in net sales in the distributor channel across all the APAC and EMEA regions of $13.7 million, a $3.3 million increase in net sales in the OEM channel of the EMEA region and a $4.2 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions. These increases were partially offset by a decrease in net sales of $1.2 million in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. In addition, there was a favorable impact of $7.6 million from foreign currency exchange primarily due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.
results.json_rows_response: As per the table above, the percentage of net sales to operating income increased by 10.8% and the percentage of operating income to operating loss decreased by 10.8%.
